data.title: Great food!
data.text: We ate here during the middle of the day after having spent time at the Strawberry Festival. Yes, the place is a bit run down but the food was fantastic! We had a BLT on a bun that was just baked that morning. The tomatoes were fresh and sweet. The bacon was perfectly cooked. We also ordered fish and chips, which were cooked just as we have had in Great Britain and Ireland. The beer we had was ice cold. The server was polite and attentive. We would definitely go back.

data.title: Great Atmosphere
data.text:
A lot of reviews saying that the place isn't Irish enough besides some of the beer selection, the flag outside, and the name of the bar. What more do you want? A leprechaun in a kilt river dancing towards you to serve you your Guinness?? Blasting stereotypical Irish music?

The atmosphere is great, and the inside is very reflective of a typical Irish pub, lots of dark green and dark wood, and a friendly atmosphere. Great food and typically great staff. 

This is a great place to visit on a weekend night when you want good drinks and to with sing karaoke or sit back and listen to others to it. The karaoke runs all night on the weekends.

The bar itself is in a great location downtown and the bar allows you to bring your drinks outside as long as you keep them within the fence, which is great for getting out of the often hot, crowded bar and into some fresh air.

data.title: Not very Irish
data.text: Pub food, good enough. Some Irish flavor to the beers, not much else. Kind of dark inside, service was good. Not very expensive so a good place for early evening group get together downtown.

data.title: Trying to be typical Irish Pub
data.text: Seemed a typical Irish bar without having a real Irish flavour . Was early in evening and so whatever customers in other bars taking advantages of happy hours . There was only one other customer in a dark room – no doubt atmosphere will change with time but avoid early doors.

data.title: Great food and service
data.text: We stop at Irish pubs when we travel. I jaf fish n chip special family had chicken n chips and salad. We loved our foor. Try the fresh cooked chips. Our waitress was awesome and friendly

data.title: Wee bit of a dive
data.text: Besides some beers, the name and the flag outside, there is really nothing Irish about this pub. The place is run down and in desperate need of a makeover. So while you may want to picture yourself in Ireland, it's more like an episode of Diners, Drive In's and Dives.

data.title: Roanoke stop over
data.text: Walked City Market area in sunny, 68F weather. Read Pub sign and walked into darkness, NFL reruns and Irish beer. Fabulous interlude on trip home.

data.title: Good for Business Lunch
data.text: Here for business and they understand what a business lunch consist of. In and out and great PUB stile food.

data.title: Great Place for a beer!
data.text: My friend and I saw the Irish flag and decided to stop in on Saturday night. The atmosphere was very casual and laid back. I was excited to see Smithwicks on tap! They also had Guinness, Harp, and Magner's Irish Cider, along with a few local brews. We got cheese curds, which are like mozzarella sticks, but way better. Our burgers were great too. I had a lot of fun with the bartenders, who were attentive and friendly. We had a great time, and will go back for another Guinness soon!

data.title: This place went DOWNHILL!!!
data.text:
A year ago around December 13th, my girlfriend and I were pleasantly surprised with this place. It was great, as the service was friendly and prompt, the cheese curds were great, and the beer was good as well. Also, the band jamming on Christmas songs added to the atmosphere.

However, we returned this year, attempting to experience the great atmosphere we encountered a year before. Wow, did this place go DOWNHILL!!! First, the bartender had the personality of a mannequin. She wasn't knowledgeable about the beer selections (what little they have), acting as if she wasn't interested. Also, she didn't understand what a Black & Tan was...isn't this an IRISH PUB??? Overall, she was cardboard and not friendly. Not to mention, the Guinness was FLAT!!!

We ordered a cup (not a bowl) of beef stew and potato soup. Other orders passed, and being patient as I am, I sat and drank my beer, without being concerned. However, after 30 minutes passed, I was wondering where the soup/stew was. I politely asked the bartender and she said, with a straight face, "it won't be long." After waiting forever, I decided to ask for my check. I was willing to pay for something I never received! Shortly after we put on our coats and paid, the soup/stew came out. 

When they FINALLY arrived, they were cold! The cheese wasn't even melted on the potato soup! I ate a few bites and decided this was prison food! I nodded to my girlfriend and we walked out. It is sad to see such a cool atmosphere go down over a year's time. We were sure that management had changed. If you want to go to an Irish Pub, keep looking! If you want good bar food and beer, keep walking! This is the WORST experience I've encountered and will NEVER waste my money on this trash again.

data.title: Fun Irish Pub!
data.text: I visited Flanary's on a recent Saturday afternoon. The place was nearly empty, but there were several TVs with sports on, and plenty of good beer on tap. Guinness, Smithwicks and Harp are available as well as other favorites. The food is good as well. Their burgers are reportedly good, but I sampled their appetizers. They have fried cheese curds! Shades of Madison, Wisconsin! They were very good however, and I recommend them. I also tried their wings. They have tradition hot buffalo wings and wings with a Guinness sauce. I had both, and both were excellent. I really liked the Guinness wings - they are different from other places, and very tasty. The barmaid was very friendly, as were the customers. I had a great chat with a local couple. In all, a fun Irish pub in the South.

data.title: Local Irish pub.
data.text: Dark atmosphere and crowd comes here but usually late at night.  Typical Irish bar food if you like greasy.  Good beers on tap.  Fun to come and watch soccer from time to time and have a beer.

data.title: meh
data.text:
Been to this place three times.  I have to say this is the worst excuse for an Irish Pub I have ever been to. For starters on St. Patrick's Day they did not have any Irish music.  Besides Guinness and a local Roanoke brew all of their beers are tailor made corporate breweries.  The staff is out of control.  The bartender, Tyler?, was giving away freebies to people he knew and barely waited on those he didn't.  The bouncer was mouthy when this was brought up to him.  The owner is nonexistent, and probably not aware of the staff running amuck.  I think the manager or possibly co-owner was hammered drunk by the time he made it to the bar at 1 AM....
The place was not that clean and bathrooms were barely sanitary at best.  The food was OKAY.  Cheese curds are decent, chicken wings are not even close, sandwiches overrated.  Much better off going to Corn Beef or Metro!  Sadly only decent Irish Pub in Roanoke is Annie Moore's which is not close to downtown.

data.title: Nothin' Fancy Irish Pub
data.text: Expect your stereotypical Irish pub -- dark interior, most patrons at the bar, standard selection of Irish-esque eats, good beers on tap.  Not fancy, but comfortable.
